etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in Robert Burns (1759–1796), poet. Variant of tatted

definitions: Of hair, the coat of an animal, etc.: tangled, matted; long and unkempt. Of a person or animal: having tangled, unkempt hair; shaggy. Compare earlier "tatted", slightly later tauty.

notes.text: Sc. National Dict. (at Taut v.) records this word as still in use in the Northern Isles, Caithness, Angus, and west central Scotland in 1972.
